English (United States)(en-US): Default Text
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹은... 모든 것의 시작

English (United States)(en-US): On the dark side of the Moon lived a boy named Red.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 뒤편에 한 소년이 살았습니다. 소년의 이름은 레드.

English (United States)(en-US): He worked at the Dream Factory, a wondrous place dedicated to crafting human dreams.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR):
그는 인간의 꿈이 만들어지는 환상적인 공간, 
‘달나라 꿈 공장’에서 일했습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): Every night, Red received the newly updated memory of his humans’ day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매일 밤이면 사랑하는 인간들의 하루가 레드에게 도착했고

English (United States)(en-US): From them he carefully selected the boldest moments to feed into the dream machine.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 중 가장 선명하고 의미 있는 기억들을 골라 꿈 기계에 넣으면

English (United States)(en-US): And with a soft twinkle, the machine popped out five fresh, vibrant dreams.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 색색깔의 꿈 구슬 다섯 개가 ‘반짝’ 하며 튀어나왔죠.

English (United States)(en-US): But Red’s task was not just to create—it was to protect.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드의 역할은 단지 꿈을 만드는 데에 그치지 않았어요. 그는 인간의 수호자기도 했습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): For even a single rotten dream could poison the human soul.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단 하나의 ‘불량 꿈’이라도 인간의 영혼을 오염시킬 수 있었기 때문이죠.

English (United States)(en-US): Red cherished his humans and every minute spent at the Dream Factory.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드는 그의 인간들을, 그리고 달나라 꿈 공장에서의 모든 순간들을 너무나도 아꼈습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): But one foggy night, a defective dream slipped past Red’s fingers,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러나 어느 안개가 짙었던 밤, 한 ‘불량 꿈’이 레드의 손틈으로 빠져나가며

English (United States)(en-US): darkening his human’s soul beyond repair.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 인간의 영혼을 완전히 망가뜨렸고

English (United States)(en-US): And Red could only watch as his dear human
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드는 그저 바라만 볼 수밖에 없었답니다.

English (United States)(en-US): walked and sank
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 소중한 인간이

English (United States)(en-US): into the deep cold void of death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음의 깊고 차가운 심연으로 걸어들어가는 것을요.

English (United States)(en-US): Like all the other failures before him,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다른 모든 실패자들과 다름없이...

English (United States)(en-US): Red was cast out to the Crater,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드 역시 ‘크레이터’로 추방되었습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): a giant pit of shattered nightmares.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳은 폐기된 꿈들이 모이는 거대한 웅덩이.

English (United States)(en-US): Now Red rakes through the filth, a servant in gloom,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드는 이제 폐기물 속을 헤맵니다.

English (United States)(en-US): bound to his punishment, an endless doom.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 형벌을 받드는 하인이 되어, 영원한 밤을 짊어진 듯이.

English (United States)(en-US): Until one fateful day,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러던 어느 운명적인 하루,

English (United States)(en-US): as Red idled through yet another uneventful afternoon,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드가 바닥을 쓸고 있던 지루한 오후에,

English (United States)(en-US): a corner of the Crater began to bubble…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 크레이터의 웅덩이 하나가 보글거리기 시작했습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): unmistakably alive.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마치... ‘살아 있는’ 것처럼요.

English (United States)(en-US): Struck by a most peculiar idea,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 별안간 아주 기상천외한 생각에 사로잡혔던 레드는

English (United States)(en-US): Red picked up a piece of chalk
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 분필을 집어들고...

English (United States)(en-US): and drew a pair of eyes on the thing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것에게 눈을 그려 주었습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): And so from the shards of dreams discarded,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 버려진 악몽들의 잔해가 뭉친 곳에서 태어난

English (United States)(en-US): was born a sticky black lump
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검고 끈적한 덩어리.

English (United States)(en-US): While Red thought it oddly endearing,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것이 기묘하게 사랑스럽다고 느끼던 레드와는 달리,

English (United States)(en-US): all the other cleaners seemed to find the creature horrifying.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다른 청소부들은 그것을 아주 경멸하는 듯했습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): MONSTER!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괴물!

English (United States)(en-US): MONSTER FROM FILTH!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 폐기물에서 나온 괴물이다!

English (United States)(en-US): But it’s harmless!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니다! 해치지 않는다!

English (United States)(en-US): Crooked Eyes!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈이 짝짝이다!

English (United States)(en-US): CURSED!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저주받은 거다!

English (United States)(en-US): Hey, I drew them!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 야! 내가 그렸다!

English (United States)(en-US): In the end, it was sentenced banishment to space…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 그것을 우주로 추방하기로 결정했습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): and certain death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것에게 죽음의 선고가 내려진 것입니다.

English (United States)(en-US): The black thing stared at the Pitch Black for a very long time…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 ‘검은 것’은 새까만 우주를 오래도록 바라보다가

English (United States)(en-US): and murmured its last words.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마지막 유언을 속삭였습니다.
“저 밖엔 나를 꿈으로 삼아 줄 다른 존재가 있을지도 몰라.”

English (United States)(en-US): In that second, gazing into its crooked eyes,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 순간, 그것의 찌그러진 눈동자 속에서

English (United States)(en-US): Red and his two friends found something
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소년 레드와 그의 두 친구들은 무언가를 발견했습니다.

English (United States)(en-US): they had not felt in a long time...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 오래도록 잊고 있었던...

English (United States)(en-US): Hope.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 희망을요.

English (United States)(en-US): So they began their preparations
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리하여 그들은 만반의 준비를 갖추기 시작했고

English (United States)(en-US): And when all was ready,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마침내 모든 준비가 끝났을 때,

English (United States)(en-US): the three moon musketeers launched the black thing to Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 검은 덩어리는 지구로 쏘아 올려집니다.

English (United States)(en-US): Along with their dreams, hopes, and their eyeballs
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달 삼총사의 꿈과 희망, 그리고 눈알을 품은 채.

English (United States)(en-US): all for the black thing to become a beautiful human dream!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오로지 인간의 아름다운 꿈이 되기 위하여!
